intro: Mahonia flavida, commonly known as the golden Mahonia, is a shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its evergreen foliage, with leathery, elliptical leaves that are dark green on top and yellowish-white underneath. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers in late winter to early spring, followed by orange-red berries that are edible for birds. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a hardy and ornamental plant for gardens. Its adaptability and visual interest make it a popular choice for landscaping in temperate climates.
